title.value: Real-Time Simultaneous Localization and Mapping with LiDAR Intensity
title.justification: The title is provided at the top of the given research paper.
title.quote: Real-Time Simultaneous Localization and Mapping with LiDAR Intensity

extractions.description: The paper proposes a novel real-time LiDAR intensity image-based simultaneous localization and mapping (SLAM) method. This method aims to address the geometry degeneracy problem in unstructured environments by extracting feature points from LiDAR-generated point clouds that match features identified in LiDAR intensity images. The method includes a front-end odometry and a back-end for joint optimization of distances between feature points and points to plane. Experimental results indicate high accuracy and robustness in various environments.

type.justification: The paper presents a novel method and includes experimental results to demonstrate its effectiveness in various environments, indicating an empirical study.
type.quote: Our experiments show that our method can run in real time with high accuracy and works well with illumination changes, low-texture, and unstructured environments.

name.quote: In this paper, we propose a novel lightweight LiDAR odometry method which directly matches 3D feature points extracted from intensity images.
